Class ArrayComparator<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.macaulay.util.ArrayComparator<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
PartialOrderComparable<T[]>, PartialOrderComparator<T[]>, PartialOrderRelativeComparable<T[]>, PartialOrderRelativeComparator<T[]>
public class ArrayComparator<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PartialOrderComparable<T[]>, PartialOrderRelativeComparable<T[]>, PartialOrderComparator<T[]>, PartialOrderRelativeComparator<T[]>

ArrayComparator Provide partial order comparisons for arrays of comparable objects.

Author:
Gary Polhill

relativeCompareTo

public PartialOrderComparison relativeCompareTo(T[] objB,
                                                T[] objC)

Specified by:
relativeCompareTo in interface PartialOrderRelativeComparable<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>[]>
Returns:
LESS_THAN if this is less similar to objC than objB, MORE_THAN if this is more similar to objC than objB, EQUAL_TO if this equals objB, and INCOMPARABLE if this and objB have incomparable differences from objC.
See Also:
PartialOrderRelativeComparable.relativeCompareTo(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

relativeCompare

public PartialOrderComparison relativeCompare(T[] objA,
                                              T[] objB,
                                              T[] objC)

Specified by:
relativeCompare in interface PartialOrderRelativeComparator<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>[]>
Returns:
LESS_THAN if objA is less similar to objC than objB, MORE_THAN if it is more similar to objC than objB, EQUAL_TO if objA.equals(objB), and INCOMPARABLE if objA and objB have incomparable differences from objC.
See Also:
PartialOrderRelativeComparator.relativeCompare(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

countDifferences

public static <U> int countDifferences(U[] arr1,
                                       U[] arr2)
                            throws IncomparableException
Count the differences between two arrays of the same length.

Parameters:
arr1 -
arr2 -
Returns:
The number of elements in arr1 for which the corresponding element in arr2 had a different value.
Throws:
IncomparableException
